They presumed the United States now could cut its military budget dramatically and spend that money at home. That perception was bolstered two years later when Colin Powell , then chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, declared: I'm running out of enemies. I'm down to Castro and Kim Il Sung . Colin Powell 's observation 20 years ago is still basically true: The United States has no militarily significant rivals, notwithstanding the terrorist threat and the war in Afghanistan.
